bibl.title: Augustan Egypt: The Creation of a Roman Province. (Studies in Classics.)
bibl.note: D.Phil. thesis, Unov. of Oxford, 2003. - 1. Introduction. - 2. The Roman Conquest of Egypt: The Precedents and the Aftermath. - 3. Ptolemaic and Roman Soldiers in Egypt before and after 30 BC. - 4. The Institutions of Egypt: The Impact of Rome. - 5. The Roman Conquest, Law, and the Administration of Justice. - 6. The Administration of the Community: Municipalisation and Liturgies. - 7. The Beginning of the Census. - 8. The Reorganisation of Landholding. - 9. Milking the Cow: Taxes and Tax Collection in Augustan Egypt. - 10. The Coinage and Monetary Circulation from Cleopatra to Tiberius. - 11. Conclusion. - Appendix: The Fasti of the Prefects of Egypt under Augustus and Tiberius. - Bibliography. Index.
CAPPONI Livia, Augustan Egypt: The Creation of a Roman Province. (Studies in Classics.)
New York - London, Routledge, 2005, 8°, xiv-308 pp., 1 carte. ISBN 0-415-97217-5. £57.
